result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey J. Nerbun

defendant.name: Nerbun, Jeffrey J.
defendant.address: P O Box 301 517 Thompson Dr, Spooner, WI 54801

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 146.  8:33 AM Court calls cases - recites appearances.  State recites plea - G/NC to count 1 and count 2 in 14 CF 161 the repeater status to be dropped and all other charges dismissed and used as read-in also 14 CF 146 dismiss read-in and will request probation.  Atty McL agrees.  Atty Nerbun agrees.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Court grants motion to delete repeater.
Atty McL  entered plea of nc to counts 1 and 2 in 14 CF 161.   Court finds defendant guilty counts 1 and 2 in 14 CF 161 repeater is deleted - other counts are dismissed and used as read-ins also 14 CF 146 is dismissed and used as read-in.  
State addressed his prior record at courts request
Atty McL makes arguement waived PSI - Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 3 years concurrent each count  90 days as to count day with credit 72 days time served with huber - costs both counts - AODA and any follow thru- any other counselling as directed by DOC to report to doc within 72 hours of release
Motion hearing on April 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion to Supress Evidence
Status conference on February 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on February 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Atty McL waived reading and entered plea of not guilty.  Court enlarged time for substitution to 1/16/15
Defense motions 2/20/15 -  STATUS 2/20/15 at 1 PM in 14 CF 146

Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Jeffrey J. Nerbun in custody.  Atty Winton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  and INIT in 14 CF 161 - Atty McL waived reading as to this file NG as to the misd. requests right for substitution at a later time.  Prelim in 14 CF 146 - Trevor Peterson called - state requests judicial notice be taken to several JOC's attached.  Court will take judicial notice.  State examines witness.  Cross- examined Atty McLaughlin.  State arguement.  Atty McL makes arguement.

Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant, Jeffrey J. Nerbun appeared with Attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Atty McL waived reading and waived time limits for preliminary exam.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed Doctor.
